forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 11pm, then showers and thunderstorms between 11pm and 2am, then rain between 2am and 5am, then a chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy. Low around 53, with temperatures rising to around 55 overnight. Southwest wind 7 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of drizzle before 11am. Sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 7 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

weather_report:
As night envelops Downtown San Francisco, a symphony of rain echoes in the cool air. The forecast whispers of showers and distant thunder, a reminder that the city’s November evenings often commence with a dance of moisture. Temperatures linger around the mid-50s, with a brisk southwest wind stirring the leaves and carrying the scent of the sea. The promise of occasional drizzle will weave through the night, painting shadows as the clouds hold dominion. The chance of precipitation reaches upward of 90%, suggesting that those with vestiges of the day still in mind may wish to secure umbrellas tightly.

In the dawn light that follows, a transformation awaits. The morning may greet you gently with the soft drumming of light drizzle before a sunlit embrace emerges. The high climbs to a mild yet pleasing 63 degrees, encouraging a shedding of layers as the day unfolds, though a northwest breeze may still remind you of your jacket. This Saturday promises clarity amid the normal tumult of urban life, with opportunities to wander the enchanting streets or perhaps settle in at a quiet café, observing the ebb and flow of city dwellers. As the sun dips and the afternoon cools, the likelihood of marine layer fog retreating to the horizon reminds you of nature’s subtle artistry, an invitation to appreciate the beauty that blankets the Bay Area.
